entry.title: Review your security vulnerabilities in GitHub with code scanning alerts
entry.summary: We’re happy to announce that SonarCloud integrates with GitHub code scanning! It’s available to everyone with a GitHub repository - private or public - independently of your SonarCloud plan. If you have access to the feature on GiHub and your organization admin already accepted the update for the SonarCloud app permissions, you’re all set! You should be able to start using the feature during your next code review.

entry.title: Horde Webmail 5.2.22 - Account Takeover via Email
entry.summary: We recently discovered a code vulnerability in Horde Webmail that can be used by attackers to take over email accounts by sending a malicious email.

entry.title: Zabbix - A Case Study of Unsafe Session Storage
entry.summary: In this article we discuss the security of client-side session storages and analyze a vulnerable implementation in the IT monitoring solution Zabbix.

entry.title: WordPress < 5.8.3 - Object Injection Vulnerability
entry.summary: We discovered an interesting code vulnerability that could be used to bypass hardening mechanisms in the popular WordPress CMS.

entry.title: How to restrict XXE resolving?
entry.summary: In this post, we'll wrap it up by discussing a more flexible solution by limiting entities resolving to those you consider safe.

entry.title: How to disable XXE processing?
entry.summary: In this post, we will see how to completely disable external entities declaration and expansion, offering a quick and safe solution.

entry.title: Don't be afraid of XXE vulnerabilities: understand the beast and how to detect them
entry.summary: Today XML External Entities (XXE) vulnerabilities are still ubiquitous, despite the fact that recommendations to protect against them have been an integral part of security standards for years. In this post, we will try to demystify XXE vulnerabilities and present the rule we put in place to help you detect and prevent them.

entry.title: WordPress 5.8.2 Stored XSS Vulnerability
entry.summary: We reported a Stored XSS vulnerability in WordPress (CVE-2022-21662) which remained unpatched for more than 3 years and affected the wordpress.org website.

entry.title: Vulnerability Research Highlights 2021

entry.title: ‘Quick Fix’ your C++ issues with SonarLint
entry.summary: ‘Quick fixes’ with SonarLint bring value to the C++ community by providing more than what they have today. Let’s take a peek at how some of these rules equip you to deliver clean and safe C++ code, efficiently.

entry.title: Modernizing your code with C++20
entry.summary: C++20 is here! It's a big release with many features designed to make your code easier, faster and safer. Let's see how the latest C++ analysis rules in SonarLint, SonarQube and SonarCloud can help us modernize our code to take advantage of some of the new features.

entry.title: Supercharge your C++ analysis with SonarLint for CLion
entry.summary: This article talks about the powerful capabilities of the C++ analyzer with SonarLint and highlights some unique and interesting quality and security rules you might find useful. Through that lens, we demonstrate how you can leverage these rules to elevate your CLion built-in static analysis capabilities for your C++ projects.
